message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM 

This paper is about learning discriminative filters using a shallow Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) for texture classification. The main focus is on encoding rotation invariance directly in the model by tying the weights of groups of filters to several rotated versions of the canonical filter in the group. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves learning procedures and techniques for improving classification performance, which suggests that it could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also involves neural networks, which suggests that it could belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves image processing and analysis, which suggests that it could also belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
